instructions: Place your mint into your right hand and give it a light slap.
Add mint and rest of ingredients to glass. Using a muddle lightly press down on the mint.
Add ice to Lewis bag and crush.
Add ice to glass about 3/4 full and stir with spoon
Top off glass with ice and garnish with handfull of mint sprigs.
Mint Julep.notes: I used the iconic Julep glass, but a rocks glass works too. Double the simple syprup if you like it sweeter. It's literally just bourbon cut with sugar and mint, and it's super easy to make.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker.
Add ice to shaker and shake your drink for 12-15 seconds.
Add ice or large ice cube to rocks glass and strain cocktail into glass.
Garnish with a lemon widge or twist.
Gold Rush.notes: This was a surprise hit and knocked out my favorite - Mint Julep - in Round 1 (I also voted for this). Honey syrup can be 1-3 parts honey per 1 part water, depending on your preference. I tend to go 3:1 for more honey flavor.

instructions: Add ingredients to mixing glass.
Add ice and stire for 30 seconds.
Strain cocktail into coupe or Martini glass.
Garnish with cherry or orange peel.
Manhattan.notes: I'm pretty sure I made this into a pitcher by multiplying the ingredients by 10.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker without ice.
Dry shake (no ice) for 30 seconds.
Add ice to shaker and shake your drink for 8-10 seconds.
Double strain into coupe or Martini glass.
Garnish with Angostura bitter drops on top.
Whiskey Sour.notes: If you can't stand the idea of egg white, most bartenders just leave it off. You can also Aquafaba. But I highly recommend giving it a try - it really cuts into the sourness. This works with any kind of whiskey. Rye makes it a little spicer.

instructions: Place all ingredients except strawberry syrup into glass with ice.
Stir for 10 seconds.
Stir in strawberry syrup to preference. I usually like 1-2 oz.
Ada Shelby.notes: This is Lindsay's version, which is different than the Peaky Blinders cocktail book. The book also calls for Sexton, but I usually use Bushmills or Tullamore Dew.

instructions: Put all ingredients, except Sprite, into cocktail shaker with ice.
Shake for 10-15 seconds.
Strain over ice into a tumbler or high ball glass.
Top off with Sprite
Green Irish Tea.notes: You'll find most receipes online are for shots, but the key is the 1:1:1 ratio of ingredients and top with Sprite. To make homemade Sweet & Sour mix, do equal parts water, sugar, lemon juice and lime juice.

instructions: Add ingredients to mixing glass.
Add ice and stir for 30 seconds.
Add large ice cube or ice to rocks glass.
Strain cocktail into glass.
Garnish with orange peel.
Old Fashioned.notes: Other syrups to try are simple syrup and Demerara Syrup. You can also experiment with different bitters. For garnish, I like to do a take an orange peel and do a U-loop around a cherry, secured with a toothpick.

instructions: Add ingredients to mixing glass.
Add ice and stir for 30 seconds.
Add large ice cube or ice to rocks glass.
Strain cocktail into coupe or Martini glass.
Garnish with lemon peel.
Improved Whiskey Cocktail.notes: Don't skip out on the absinthe. It really makes the drink. You can try different styles of whiskey like bourbon, but Rye seemed to be the favorite.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker.
Add ice and shake for 8–10 seconds.
Double strain into coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with apple slice or cherry.
Appletini.notes: Want a more red apple style cocktail? Try adding 0.75 oz of cranberry.

instructions: Add ice to a Collins glass.
Add vodka and orange juice to glass.
Lightly stir with bar spoon for 20 seconds.
Float Galliano on top and garnish with orange wedge and optional cherry.

ingredients: Garnish: Lime Wheel or Orange Peel
instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker, then add ice.
Shake drink for 8–10 seconds.
Double strain into Martini glass.
Garnish with lime wheel or orange peel.
Add vodka, peach schnapps, and orange juice to shaker.
Add ice and shake your drink for 8–10 seconds.
Add ice to glass, add in cranberry, and strain rest of cocktail into glass.
Garnish with orange wheel and cherry.
Sex on the Beach.notes: Adding cranberry first creates a fun layered look, but stir the cocktail before you drink it for the best flavor.

instructions: Add ingredients to rocks glass.
Add ice to rocks glass.
Use bar spoon and lightly stir for 10 seconds.
Black Russian.notes: Kahlúa is the primary choice; use more or less depending on how sweet you'd like the cocktail.

instructions: Add vodka, lime juice, and simple syrup to shaker.
Add ice and shake your drink for 8–10 seconds.
Add ice to copper mug and strain drink into mug.
Top drink with ginger beer and garnish with a lime wedge.
Moscow Mule.notes: Some ginger beers are sweeter than others. Only add simple syrup if you have a spicier ginger beer.

ingredients: 36 leaves fresh mint, or to taste
instructions: Muddle sugar and mint leaves together in pitcher until leaves are well broken down.
Add limes and muddle until limes are juiced.
Pour rum into sugar mixture; add club soda and stir until sugar is dissolved.
Serve and enjoy.
Mojito.notes: This obviously makes a pitcher, not just a drink. Don't over-muddle the mint or it looks kinda grimey.

instructions: Add tequila and orange juice to shaker.
Add ice to shaker and shake your drink for 8–10 seconds.
Add grenadine to bottom of Collins glass.
Add ice to glass and strain cocktail.
Using a bar spoon, lightly stir.
Garnish with orange wedge.
Tequila Sunrise.notes: Elevate this cocktail with homemade grenadine. For homemade grenadine: combine 2 cups pomegranate juice, 2 cups sugar, ¼ cup pomegranate molasses, 1 tsp orange flower water, and 15 ml vodka. Stir in pot on low heat and bottle.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker.
(Optional) Place ice in Lewis bag and pound ice to crush.
Add ice to shaker and shake your drink for 8–10 seconds.
Pour all contents of shaker into glass and top with ice if needed.
Garnish with orange slice and cherry.
Hurricane.notes: Passionfruit syrup recipe: mix passion fruit purée and simple syrup in a 1:1 ratio. You can also find passion fruit syrups online.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker.
Add ice to shaker and shake your drink for 8–10 seconds.
Double strain into glass.
Garnish with lime wheel.

ingredients: 18 oz Cold Water or Ice (for dilution)
Garnish: Mint Sprigs, Orange Slices, Pineapple Wedges
instructions: Combine all ingredients except garnish in a large punch bowl or pitcher.
Stir well and chill at least 1 hour before serving.
Add a large block of ice or several big cubes to keep cool without quick dilution.
Garnish the bowl with mint sprigs, orange slices, and pineapple wedges.
Ladle into individual glasses over ice.
Planter's Punch.notes: Obviously this is a punch. I honestly can't remember if I used this exact recipe or tweaked it a bit. I should have saved it

instructions: Place all ingredients into a shaker.
Add ice and shake for 8–10 seconds.
Double strain into a coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with an orange peel or cherry.
Blood & Sand.notes: My favorite Blended Scotch for this is Johnny Walker Black. Try substituting pineapple juice for orange juice for a brighter tropical twist.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a mixing glass.
Add ice and stir for 30 seconds.
Strain into a coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with a cherry or orange peel.

ingredients: Garnish: Sugar Rim and Lemon Peel
instructions: Add sugar rim to coupe or martini glass.
Place all ingredients into a shaker.
Add ice and shake for 8–10 seconds.
Double strain into prepared glass.
Garnish with lemon peel.
Sidecar.notes: I've tried this with VSOP brandy and Cognac, and it makes a very different drink.

instructions: Place all ingredients into a mixing glass.
Add ice and stir for 30 seconds.
Strain into a rocks glass over ice or a large cube.
Garnish with a cherry and include a spoonful of cherry juice.
Vieux Carre.notes: Judd introduced the cherry-juice trick, and it really makes the drink by sweetening it up just a bit

instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup to shaker.
Add ice and shake for 8–10 seconds.
Strain into champagne flute.
Add Sparkling wine to fill glass.
Garnish with lemon twist.
French 75.notes: Korbel makes 12 oz bottles of sparking wine so you don't have to open a big 750mL bottle.

instructions: Mix everything into a large pitcher or punch bowl.
Chill in fridge for at least 2 hours (or overnight)
Pour from puch bowl into a rocks glass with ice (maybe big ice cube)
Optionally garnish the cup with orange peel.
Negroni.notes: This is obviously a punchified version that I made. Traditionally, the gin/vermouth/Campari is 1:1:1, but it was coming out too bitter. I also added the orange juice and bitters to capture the slight flavor you normally get from the garnish. Also the cold water you get from the dilution.

ingredients: 0.75 cup agave syrup or simple syrup
3 cups chilled club soda or grapefruit soda (Squirt or Jarritos)
Garnish: Grapefruit slices, lime wheels, orange wheels.
instructions: Combine everything except the soda in large pitcher or punch bowl.
Stir very well to dissolve the agave and salt
Chill in the fridge for at least 2 hours
Just before serving, add ice and gently top with the soda to keep it fizzy
Garnish generously with citrus slices
Rim glassware with Tajin slat
Cantarito.notes: This is obviously a punchified version that I made. This is traditionally served in clay cups, but I just served in a rocks glass.
